task_summary: Detect the T-block and target, approach and align, set yaw, execute two push strokes toward the goal, verify arrival, then retreat. Control/observation at 10 Hz.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-type manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a marked target outline on a tabletop. The sequence begins with perception of the block and the goal area, followed by an approach from above and in-plane alignment. The tool yaw is set to match the push direction along the table. The robot performs two short pushes to translate and settle the block into the target outline, checks that the block is at the goal, and finally retreats to clear the workspace. Timing is modest with sub-second action timeouts.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except the T-block and target outline
Camera/extrinsics calibrated so object/goal can be detected
Robot reachable workspace includes block and target zone
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and align laterally.
Set tool yaw for push direction.
Execute two push strokes toward the target.
Verify the block is within the target outline.
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance
No collision with fixtures or leaving the workspace
End-effector disengaged and clear at task end
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-detect objects and realign
Misalignment or slip: perform an extra push cycle
Insufficient motion: increase push distance on retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when IsAt(target_zone) succeeds and the robot retreats to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above the block with small clearance.
Lateral approach and alignment for pushing.
Verify the block remains visible before push.
Execute a push stroke toward the target.
Check block is at target zone.
Back off to clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Object or target not detected due to glare/occlusion
Tool misalignment causing rotation of the T-block
Insufficient push distance, block stops short
recovery_strategy: Add an extra push cycle with same parameters
Re-approach and adjust yaw before another push
If overshoot, push in opposite direction with smaller distance
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue outline target, not gray/green as in the instruction; frames were preferred.
Camera frame for direction_deg=0 assumed to correspond to the observed push direction (rightward in images).
Contact sensing not available; visual checks used instead.

expected_success_criteria: Block contour overlaps target outline; IsAt(target_zone) returns success; tool retreats clear
